text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Inauguration of the second sector of the Maghreb-Europe gas pipeline, a factor for regional economic integration.
- Vehicle insurance turnover increased by 16 percent to 2.7 billion dirhams ($318 million) in 1995.
- Agreement to be signed between Morocco and Spain to convert 40 percent of Moroccan debt into investment projects.
- Morocco and France to strengthen cultural and scientific cooperation.
- Agricultural fund lifts ceiling on loans to farmers to help boost agricultural output and extend areas of irrigation.
- Rain and cold expected across Morocco from Wednesday.
- Twelve million rats pose health hazard in Casablanca.
- Moroccan businessmen pay visit to Egypt.
